alert.note: Alert for Eastern Franklin; Grand Isle; Western Chittenden; Western Franklin (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 19 at 5:03AM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...Heavy snow will impact portions of Clinton, central Franklin, southeastern St. Lawrence, and Essex Counties in New York, and Grand Isle, northwestern Chittenden and Franklin Counties in Vermont through 600 AM EDT... At 502 AM EDT, heavy snow was reported along a line extending from 12 miles north of Berkshire, Vermont to near Indian Lake, New York. Movement was northwest at 30 mph. HAZARD...Visibility less than a half mile, and snow accumulation up to 1 inch per hour. Roads will quickly become snow covered and slippery. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Low visibility will pose a hazard to motorists. Accumulating snow will make travel difficult. Locations impacted include... Plattsburgh International Airport, Burlington, Tupper Lake, Saranac Lake, Adirondack Regional Airport, Plattsburgh, South Burlington, Lake Placid, Burlington International Airport, Essex, Peru, Beekmantown, Schuyler Falls, Chazy, Saranac, Mooers, Altona, Willsboro, Enosburg Falls and Westport. This includes Interstate 89 between mile markers 87 and 129.
info.instruction: Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time when traveling.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Franklin; Grand Isle; Western Chittenden; Western Franklin
